metadata.title: CVE-2016-7406 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
Format string vulnerability in Dropbear SSH before 2016.74 allows remoteattackers to execute arbitrary code via format string specifiers in the (1)username or (2) host argument.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7406` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

dropbear - 2016.74-1
dropbear-bin - 2016.74-1
dropbear-initramfs - 2016.74-1
dropbear-run - 2016.74-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: dropbear package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2016.74-1').
